The two basic forces we generally experience in our everyday lives are gravity and electromagnetism. Gravity only tends to be significant when you are relatively near to something very large. This is the force that pulls us towards the Earth and keeps the Earth revolving around the sun. Electromagnetism accounts for almost all of the other pushes and pulls we experience. When you push on a box, the electrons in your hand repel the electrons in the box; this creates both the force that moves the box and the force you feel as the box pushes back at you. Friction is caused by similar electromagnetic interactions between the atoms in the box and the atoms in the floor.
